summary: This is a letter motion from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, requesting that the birth certificates of the minor victims be deemed self-authenticating under Federal Rule of Evidence 902 to avoid calling records custodians from five state agencies to testify at trial. The government notes it has provided certified copies to the defense, which has not agreed to stipulate to their authenticity.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell).

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the Ghislaine Maxwell case to whom this letter motion is addressed.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who submitted this letter motion.

connections.description: Williams, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the prosecution against defendant Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Government Motion on Birth Certificate Authentication
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a motion requesting the court to rule that the minor victims' birth certificates are self-authenticating documents under Federal Rule of Evidence 902.

locations: 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The government is in possession of certified birth certificates for multiple minor victims in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, marked as Government Exhibits 11-16.
The defense has not agreed to stipulate to the authenticity of these birth certificates, forcing the government to file this motion to have them deemed self-authenticating.
The government seeks to avoid the logistical burden of calling records custodians from five different state agencies to testify at trial.
The motion argues the birth certificates are self-authenticating under Federal Rule of Evidence 902(4) as certified copies of public records bearing appropriate seals and signatures.

The document references that certain victims and witnesses are testifying under pseudonyms, and the government is coordinating with the DOJ Office of International Affairs regarding a foreign birth certificate (Witness-3's).
